meanings.definition: To separate twisted or knotted threads, cords, etc.
meanings.sent1: She spent hours untangling her necklace.
meanings.sent2: He carefully untangled the fishing line from the tree branch.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried untangling the yarn but only made it worse.
meanings.sent4: Her soothing voice untangled the tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: The magician's trick involved untangling a chain in seconds.

meanings.definition: To clarify or resolve a complicated situation.
meanings.sent1: The teacher did a great job untangling the confusing math problem.
meanings.sent2: They worked together untangling the misunderstanding between them.
meanings.sent3: The detective enjoyed untangling the mystery of the missing diamond.
meanings.sent4: His wise advice helped untangle the complicated family feud.
meanings.sent5: The mediator was skilled at untangling disputes and finding solutions.
